t: Proverbs 8
The Blessings of Wisdom
Does*pn not wisdom call? Does*ld not understanding raise her voice?
On*ln the heights beside the way, at*ld the crossroads she takes her stand;
beside*ln the gates in front of the town, at*ld the entrance of the portals she cries aloud:
“To*ln you, O men, I call, and*ld my cry is to the children of man.
O*ln simple ones, learn prudence; O*ld fools, learn sense.
Hear,*ln for I will speak noble things, and*ld from my lips will come what is right,
for*ln my mouth will utter truth; wickedness*ld is an abomination to my lips.
All*ln the words of my mouth are righteous; there*ld is nothing twisted or crooked in them.
They*ln are all straight to him who understands, and*ld right to those who find knowledge.
Take*ln my instruction instead of silver, and*ld knowledge rather than choice gold,
for*ln wisdom is better than jewels, and*ld all that you may desire cannot compare with her.
“I,*pn wisdom, dwell with prudence, and*ld I find knowledge and discretion.
The*ln fear of the Lord*s is hatred of evil. Pride*ln and arrogance and the way of evil and*ld perverted speech I hate.
I*ln have counsel and sound wisdom; I*ld have insight; I have strength.
By*ln me kings reign, and*ld rulers decree what is just;
by*ln me princes rule, and*ld nobles, all who govern justly.
I*ln love those who love me, and*ld those who seek me diligently find me.
Riches*ln and honor are with me, enduring*ld wealth and righteousness.
My*ln fruit is better than gold, even fine gold, and*ld my yield than choice silver.
I*ln walk in the way of righteousness, in*ld the paths of justice,
granting*ln an inheritance to those who love me, and*ld filling their treasuries.
“The*pn Lord*s possessed me at the beginning of his work, the*ld first of his acts of old.
Ages*ln ago I was set up, at*ld the first, before the beginning of the earth.
When*ln there were no depths I was brought forth, when*ld there were no springs abounding with water.
Before*ln the mountains had been shaped, before*ld the hills, I was brought forth,
before*ln he had made the earth with its fields, or*ld the first of the dust of the world.
When*ln he established the heavens, I was there; when*ld he drew a circle on the face of the deep,
when*ln he made firm the skies above, when*ld he established the fountains of the deep,
when*ln he assigned to the sea its limit, so*ld that the waters might not transgress his command, when*ln he marked out the foundations of the earth,
then*ld I was beside him, like a master workman, and*ln I was daily his delight, rejoicing*ld before him always,
rejoicing*ln in his inhabited world and*ld delighting in the children of man.
“And*pn now, O sons, listen to me: blessed*ld are those who keep my ways.
Hear*ln instruction and be wise, and*ld do not neglect it.
Blessed*ln is the one who listens to me, watching*ld daily at my gates, waiting*ld beside my doors.
For*ln whoever finds me finds life and*ld obtains favor from the Lord,*s
but*ln he who fails to find me injures himself; all*ld who hate me love death.”
